definition: to face the wall/to sit facing the wall in meditation (Buddhism)/(fig.) to devote oneself to study, work etc
flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
variant of 麵|面[mian4]
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc
wall/rampart
to face the wall and ponder about one's misdeeds/to stand in the corner (punishment)/(fig.) to examine one's conscience

sentences.english: Your answer isn't face the wall.
sentences.chinese: 解决问题的答案不在面壁上。

sentences.english: From then on he just sat silently all day long, facing the wall, practicing "wall contemplation; "Perhaps he was waiting for someone.
sentences.chinese: 从此面壁而坐，终日默默修炼，也许他在等待着谁。

sentences.english: I think I'd rather go shoe shopping before staring at the walls in some library.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得我在去图书馆面壁之前还是先去逛逛鞋店吧。

sentences.english: Software Description: About Frozen Kale I, This is a colorful picture of wilted, frozen kale .
sentences.chinese: 这是憔悴冰冷的羽衣甘蓝的一张生动的相片桌面壁纸。

sentences.english: Please click the pictures below for free download of wallpaper.
sentences.chinese: 请点击以下图片，免费下载《秘密花园》的桌面壁纸。

sentences.english: He studied with undivided attention for three years, and finally finished this long novel.
sentences.chinese: 他面壁三年，终于完成了这部长篇小说。

definition: to face the wall and ponder about one's misdeeds/to stand in the corner (punishment)/(fig.) to examine one's conscience
to reflect on one's past errors
(Buddhism) to sit in contemplation
to close the passes/to seal off the country/seclusion (monastic practice, e.g. of Chan Buddhists)
shut oneself up and ponder over one's mistakes
contemplation/meditation
(Buddhism) to enter a meditative state
to put in detention (a soldier, a pupil)
to punish by protracted kneeling
to sit in meditation/to meditate
to sit quietly/to meditate/to stage a sit-in
to practice Chan Buddhist meditation/to practice Zen meditation/to sit in meditation
to practice work skill
to examine oneself/to reflect on one's shortcomings/introspection/self-awareness/self-criticism
to violate a religious precept/to smoke or drink after giving up
to comprehend (the nature of things etc)/to achieve enlightenment
